radiographic_examinations.findings: Moderately severe centrilobular emphysema with bilateral lower-lobe basilar opacities, which may represent mild atelectasis, aspiration, or pneumonia. The main pulmonary artery was dilated.

Emphysema with bronchial-wall thickening and new tree-in-bud and small nodular and reticular opacities in the lower lobes, right middle lobe, and lingula. A new irregular nodular opacity in the right lower lobe measured 1.8 cm by 1.4 cm, considered to represent aspiration or pneumonia. No evidence of pulmonary emboli.
New hazy opacities in both lungs, most prominently in the right middle lobe.

Bilateral ground-glass opacities, more severe in the right middle lobe, right lower lobe, and superior segment of left lower lobe; less severe in the upper lobes. Tree-in-bud and nodular opacities from the previous CT had resolved, consistent with resolved pneumonia. No evidence of mediastinal or hilar lymphadenopathy or pleural effusions. No traction bronchiectasis or honeycombing.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: The previously noted tree-in-bud and nodular opacities had resolved.
